rotation_strategy.description: Track ID determines which formula is used: (ID - 1) % 5 = formula index

[GENRE].description: Track genre, capitalized, hyphens to spaces

[HEADLINE IN 6 WORDS].description: First 6 words of the headline, or full if shorter
[HEADLINE IN 6 WORDS].example: Full headline: 'AI systems breakthrough in natural language understanding' -> 'AI systems breakthrough in natural language'

[HEADLINE].example: AI systems breakthrough in natural language understanding

Classic.delivery: Confident, informative. Like a knowledgeable insider.
Classic.emphasis: Put weight on the genre and mood names. 'Let it run' = calm command.
Classic.pauses: Comma after 'frequency', comma after genre/mood combo

Cryptic.emphasis: Build up to 'we wrote the chorus' like it's a victory.
Cryptic.pauses: Long pause after 'rule.' Shorter pause before 'we wrote'.

Sarcastic.delivery: Dry, dismissive. Like 'oh, you heard that news too?'
Sarcastic.emphasis: 'Today's headline' = matter-of-fact. 'bass' = final answer, no debate.
Sarcastic.pauses: Short pauses. Let the sarcasm land.

Retro.delivery: Wistful, slightly amused. Like remembering an old joke.
Retro.emphasis: Make '1986 had neural nets' sound absurd and funny.
Retro.pauses: Pause after '1986'. Let that sink in.

End-times.delivery: Dark but resigned. Like you knew this was coming.
End-times.emphasis: 'Civilization: questionable' = accepting the inevitable. 'Groove: undeniable' = the only thing left that matters.
End-times.pauses: Long pause after each colon. Build weight.
